reviews.review:
I beat Bioshock 1 as a little kid, and replayed it last year. I replayed Bioshock 2 this year as well, and never got into the swing of that. But Bioshock Infinite... on the par of combat, it is amazing. Better than B1 in almost every combat aspect. The rail system allows for a, well, infinite amount of angles to approach and attack enemies. The sounds go so well, such as the ending of combat music, the ding of headshots, or the blare of an incoming airship.

Ambiance - sad, a feeling of despair. B1 had that feeling of sorrow, unknown, and the light of hope. Infinite brings out that aspect, with the addition of empathy, regret, etc. I felt so many conflicting emotions. Sadly, it's not as horrific as Bioshock 1 and 2, which was one of the main reasons I remember those games so well. The boys of silence are frightening, but so trivial in the development of the plot. Sadly they appear for only one level. Songbird is obviously similar to the Big Daddies, but he's just one compared to the hundreds Big Daddies in Rapture.

 The story is captivating, the characters bring tears, the plot twists just swing out at you with amazing detail, and truthfully the ending is ... amazing.  Play it, buy it, live it, love it.

Awesome game!

Interesting storyline, interesting characters, fun environment, awesome gameplay!!! Everything you could want in a game!

Would rate 100/10!

Great game.  Visuals are nice, pacing of the game is spot on.  Only criticism is certain elements of the story will seem very convoluted and may require a person to see a few times to get all the details.  But that last criticism is more of a nitpick, if you like first person shooters and want an engrossing story this game is really worth a look.

7/10
as you would expect from bioshock this game takes you to a world that is like no other 
good story looks good but i would say the 2nd one is the best 
getting some of the strange powers in this one is easyer i dont think thats a good thing
and your character gets stuck on walls some times so bugging as you need to be a moving target to have a chance

This game is very fun. The graphics turn out very nice even though I am not running the best of graphic cards. I have played small parts of the first two bioshoch games, but it is not hard to catch up on the story.

Ich denke, das Spiel verdient mindestens einen Platz in den Top 3 meiner lieblsten (Singerlplayer-)Spiele. Stilsicher fast bis zur Perfektion. Filmisch inszenierte Story und Dialoge die zum Denken anregen. Gameplay ist zwar nur gut, aber was den Tiefgang angeht, stell BioShock Infinite JEDES Spiel in den Schatten und lässt die zwar noch jungle- aber längst für ein paar gut erzählte Geschichten überfällige- Spieleindustrie regelrecht entblößen. 9.2/10
best bioshock game
It's good, i painted all the clouds in this game

Theres not much to say besides this game completly changes the way i look at bioshock games (if you payed attention to hte hints youd know what i mean) the ending is mind blowing and the overall tale is great. The combat is quite smooth with the ability to use vigors (basically super powers) and weapons at the same time. It also rocks that the whole game isnt an escort mission and that elixabeth(buy the game and find out about her) isnt useless and her AI is quite nice. The only concerns i have is that the combat is a bit to easy at teh begninig and then they throw you into really hard fire fights but in the end you can always count on youre vigors to help. I definetly reccomend the game and give it a 9/10

A indecisão entre rpg e primeira pessoa deixou o jogo muito fraco,  além de um bug em que no porto (qdo fica falando com os membros do vox) fui jogado no abismo e tive de voltar na fase anterior para resolver o problema, agora que estou quase no fim , parece impossivel destruir todos os zeppelins....
i like turtles

I had not played any of the previous BioShock games, tbh i just happened to pick it up in the Summer Steam Sale. it would have been worth it to buy it full price. Great animation, great story line , and subtly creepy with all the good ol' boy religion stuff. I strongly recrommend this game and if you can pick it up during a sale....DO EEEETT!
Ótimo!!!

Quero deixar aqui bem claro que esse foi o 1º Bioshock da trilogia que joguei
Então essa análise é para muitos que como eu, que não conhecia a franquia  e vai sentir mais ou menos o jogo nesse sentido ;)
No início vc se sente um pouco perdido, pois, não sabe bem o que esperar, mas quando você enfim se encontra em columbia percebe-se que sim será uma aventura maravilhosa.
A cidade dos céus é linda, um éden, mas, esconde mazelas e horrores com a sua grande parte populacional é manipulada pela a idolatria.
Bioshock Infinite vai te levar a esse mundo de credulidade. segredos, e muita bala e pancadaria.
Você protagoniza o Mr. Booker DeWitt que tem como objetivo de início resgatar uma Lady a Elizabeth, para pagar dívidas com pessoas nada agradáveis.
Enfim, recomendo muito Bioshock Infinite, pelo que vocês observam meu avatar e nome é do protagonista, não um dos pois a Elizabeth é tão protagonista quanto Booker, pode ter certeza ela não será aquela companheira chata como o Resident Evil 4, ele tem uma inteligência e delicadeza enorme, quando vc começa a jogar junto dela, ai sim o jogo fica mais divertido ;)
As pessoas que nunca jogaram Bioshock 1 ou 2, a história de Bioshock Infinite não dá spoilers dos outros Bioshocks, não o jogo principal, as coisas começam a se estreitar na DLC Burial at Sea.

Resumindo: Bioshock é um jogo perfeito, história muito bem feita e encantadora, numa cidade de se encher os olhos d'água de tão linda e perfeita.

10/10 Everthing ;)
Super crash-tastic!

Прошел игру за 1 присест (9 часов непрерывной игры), никак не мог оторваться. Всем любителям хорошего сюжета и нескучных перестрелок ( а учитывая множество вариантов убийства врагов, так оно и есть) советую.
Yet again, Bioshock delivers an amazing game with great story and gameplay. 10/10
my game of the year for 2013

Bitches be like, 'What is so good about Bioshock: Infinite?'. Take a seat and buckle up, faggot.
This game be tots crazy. Like, 'holla holla get dolla' material. Have ya'll bitches ever shot hellfire out of your hands? Didn't fucking think so. Can you ride a sky-rail around the fucking place whilst shooting your pistol in real life? Can you fuck.
Ever rescued a fine ass honey from a tower only to be hunted down by an entire army as well a giant metal bird? Hellz to the naw.

So if you want the greatest experience of your life, you better buy this game, buckle up and get ready for a wicked ass time, yo.

10/10 fo-shizzle ma dizzle.

Wow, After finishing this game I can say it was easily one of the most unsatisfying and uncreative endings I have ever encountered.  I wish I could somehow get back the mere 12 hours it took to finish it and do something more enjoyable like get a root canal or practice chewing on glass.  The game has fine graphics and bugless, unoffensive (if somewhat dull), gameplay.  But the story being told is nothing but a vastly over-extended lead in to a cliched 'gotcha' ending that will leave most players felling like they've just been fed a giant turd sandwich.  Even at $9.99 this game is not worth the time or expense and I deeply regret having played it.

Overall I felt Bioshock Infinite was a very good game, easily a 9/10. Got it for $10 during the Autumn sale which is always a big plus. The game did seem short though. I clocked in at 7.8 hours my first playthrough on normal while exploring a lot.

Good Story, 
but gameplay is utter shit.

This game is a masterpiece. The combat is tons of fun great shooter bliss. What makes this game stand out from among the rest is its fantastic story. Though at the beggining this game seems like it has nothing to do with Bioshock 1 but you will later find out that it indeed does. the ending for this game is absolutly fantastic. 10/10
Игра на высшем уровне)

Bioshock Infinite isn't a horrible game, it isn't anywhere close to being the worst I've ever played, but it highlights the unhealthy mindset game developers have today. This game has received so much praise that it physically pains me, because I know in the back of my mind people with no concept of consumerism are buying into this hype train wreck.

Bioshock Infinite has repetitive gunplay with unsatisfying weapons that are better than their successors that appear later in the game when upgraded. It has horrible hostile A.I. that uses no form of logic other than aggressively running into the open and mindlessly attacking the player. There is also a lack of unique enemy types to freshen up the combat, and any uncommon enemy that is in the game can still be killed by simply shooting at them. No enemy types require any form of special strategy or apporach to defeat them, so the unique enemy types serve no purpose, and may as well be normal generic enemies. The vigors lack variety, and often just replace functions that mixed up the gameplay in previous installments of the series. Many of the combat vigors are simply grenades with fancy skins and a tripmine feature. Also the enemy A.I. hardly makes use of vigors, only the flame and crow enemies use any type of Vigor. Splicers in previous Bioshock titles used plasmids very often, and made enemy encounters more varied, plus with vigors taking the same role as plasmids, should they not be a commonly used tool among the citizens of Columbia? The tear feature is extremely under-utilized, and doesn't alter the game environment during combat nearly enough to really keep the experience fresh. So every fight narrows down to shooting at bullet sponge enemies and throwing vigor grenades. 

Escort missions have always been things players dread, but many games have achieved amazing escort mechanics such as Yoshi's Island, Resident Evil 4 and Ico. Instead of actually trying to be inventive, and making escort mechanics seem less of a chore, Irrational Games decided to remove the gameplay element of escorting Elizabeth from the equation entirely (either to pander to the feminists, or avoid the risk of adding something idiots may think is too hard). Elizabeth is unarmed the entire game in the middle of gunfights, there's no way she can, "Take care of herself," without having a weapon or some line of defense. Despite the enemy's main objective to be capturing Elizabeth, they make no efforts to do so during combat. In Ico and Yoshi's Island, the goal of the enemy faction is to capture your partner, that's why preventing them from being captured is an element to the gameplay. Why is Elizabeth in the game? Answer: To pander to Tumblr psuedo feminists who want capable female characters instead of good gameplay, and neckbeards who want to be together with Elizabeth forever. Elizabeth is a useless friendly A.I. that doesn't aid but rather wastes the players time spawning ammo, health, money or other items (due to the previously mentioned bullet-sponge enemies draining you of your ammo, and the enemies dropping ammo for guns randomly, instead of based on the weapons you are currently using) and stripping control away from the player or clouding the screen with a button prompt to receive the item you could have simply picked up yourself, and in no way takes part in combat. While she can pick locks, there is no reason Booker himself couldn't have been given this abilty during development. Either way, you still have to command her to pick the locks, so you might as well be doing it yourself, her doing it for you also removes the possibility of having lockpicking being an aspect to Infinite's gameplay. The tear ability still requires you to command Elizabeth to utilize it, therefore the ability might as well be Booker's. If Elizabeth had an A.I. that utilized tears based on which would be more advantageous to you at any given time, this would have actually given Elizabeth a purpose in the game; too bad that would require work on Irrational Games's part.

Infinite is also highly praised for its atmosphere, but I disagree with this claim.  Attention to detail on the player's part will immediately remove them from the environment they are meant to be immersed in. This game's visuals are praised to be groundbreaking, but only because they used the trite orange-blue contrast everywhere they could instead of the color brown. Level design clashes with the gameplay. Now, the first Bioshock was closterphobic, cramped, tightly packed, consisting of small arenas or hallways. This compliments the more simplistic, arcade-y FPS elements of the game, where you can avoid exposing yourself to many enemies, and reveal yourself to make a quick offensive. In Infinite you have a two weapon limit, so you can't pull out a sniper (you might not have one) and make an offense in the open, you have to approach your enemy, expose yourself, and be forced to take damage. Even the enemy design clashes here, where they'll run at you with melee weapons and be slaughtered by you in the wide open spaces. The melee weapons were useful in Rapture, where enemies could ambush you and get solid hits on you, here it's assanine.

Most of this game's "atmosphere" should be credited to fancy skyboxes, and bloom. Whenever I started to take in the environment, something stupid would completely spoil everything. The biggest of all being the first person cutscenes, where the game makes you watch your character do things you didn't command him to do in first person view, the main display mode of the gameplay. When playing a platformer, cutscenes don't play from the stock camera angle, or else you'd be still be in the mindset of trying to control your character, and being surprised to find out that conrol of them has been stripped from you, immediately taking you out of the game.The same rule applies here, the first person view is reserved for the gameplay, so transitions from gameplay to cutscenes are less jarring. Another huge video game sin is where the game presents choices to you through button prompts. These decision making moments aren't presented in the gameplay's format, the gameplay is stopped so you can press a button and watch your decision unfold. One should be prompted to make a decision without being removed from the actual gameplay; the whole Half Life 2 "pick up the can." scenario is a perfect example where you are presented with choice without removing you from the gameplay. The setting of Infinite is nowhere near as compelling as Rapture, where you'd wander the deserted hallways and wonder what life was like before it all fell apart. Instead, Infinite seems to prefer shoving controversial issues like racism or patriotism in, and never actually do anything intellectual with the themes presented.

The game's focus on narrative is problematic as well, simply because it takes importance over the game's gameplay; the most important part of any game. People seem to think writing has to be "cerebral" or "deep" to be good, but a simpler story that's charming, horrifying, campy, epic, joyful, or heart-breaking is just as, if not more compelling. Story is something that can be enjoyed on the side. Games shouldn't have to confrom to movies or literature, they are unique in that the player experiences them instead of watching or reading them; the events of the game are happening to you, so you are already invested in the adventure. Video games are about the actions you perform while playing them, the lessons you learn and the the emotions you have while perfoming them, and the sense of accomplishment you experience from overcoming the challenges the game made you face along the way. This game isn't worth your time or money, because it forgets the fact that video games are about the experience of playing them. Anyone willing to look at this game critically will know that buying it is a huge mistake, and a vote for games going further in the wrong direction.

Puntuación personal: 9/10

Hay que decir que hay un gran salto desde el primer BioShock, que por cierto, fue de lo mejorcito, al igual que este.

Respecto a los gráficos, decir que se ve espectacular para ser un juego de 2012. Además, para aquellos que no tienen un ordenador con una potencia descomunal, decirles que el juego no exige tanto.

Lo que más me está gustando del juego es la historia, te engancha desde el principio. Tiene ese toque que Irrational Games sabe darle.

El apartado de jugabilidad, me tiene encantado, tiene la misma jugablidad que la primera entrega o incluso mejor, además de que los poderes nuevos son de lo mejor. Están muy currados.

Y lo que viene a ser duración, no puedo decir mucho, ya que aún no lo he acabado. Espero que tenga una duración aceptable.

Lo que no me acaba de convencer es la inteligencia artificial, tiene algunos fallos.

Pues este es mi pequeño análisis. Espero que os guste.

This game is downright amazing! The story made me fall in love with all the characters from the main ones to the randome creepy ones. I cannot put this game down. The environments are amazing. The artwork is simly marvelous. The small details are just outstanding. You really feel yourself immersed in Columbia. The gameplay on a whole is not as good as the first two Bioshocks, but the story is fantastic enough that you really don't care. The episodes (DLC content) was equally fantasic. I plan to play the entire game from beginnning to end more times in the near future.

music - 9/10
visuals - 10/10
gameplay - 9/10
controls - 9.5/10
story - 10/10

Overall I give this a 9.5/10. I will (and have) return to get mindf**cked again.
I don't want to go over the top here, but this is literally the best series I've ever played

Ein großartiges Spiel, sowohl die Story als auch die Grafik sind sehr ansprechend. Sehr schöne Spielwelt mit vielen detaillierten Einzelheiten schaffen eine großartige Atmosphäre. Ganz klare Kaufempfehlung. Bioshock Infinite kann einiges.

Auch nach der längeren Veröffentlichung dank der DLCs immer wieder einen Blick wert.

Graphics - 10/10
Combat - 10/10
Story - 11/10
Music - 10/10
Voice Acting - 10/10

Overall - 10/10

You start off playing a man known as Booker Dewitt, a gambler in debt sent on a job to retrieve a girl from the city of Columbia and to bring her back to New York unharmed.

The game takes place in a fictional 1912, with some of the most beautiful visuals in video games to date, best viewed on pc of course but the games best part of playing has to be the story. 

By the end of the game your jaw will hit the fucking floor. No joke, the huge plot twist of the story is something you would expect to see in a really good tv show. I'm still mind blown from it. Probably the best 10$ pruchase i'v ever made thanks to the steam autumn sale. If I knew how amazing the game was I would have bought it when it came out for 60$.

DLC - Burial at Sea Episode 1

Pretty short but worth buying especially if you can get it on sale. Graphics and visuals are gorgeous as usual. The story is a bit different from the full game but still has an interesting enough ending to make me want to buy episode 2 when it comes out.
Обзор? Никаких обзоров, игра шедевральна и точка.
non si puo non giocare a questo gioco

If you haven't already played this, do it. I won't spoil it for you but it is awesome in the original meaning of the word. The enviroment is breath-taking, the characters so well done, the story gripping, the gameplay is tons of fun and you'll want to replay it the moment you are done. Truly one of the best games I have ever played.

It's worth noting that this game is strictly linear which I personally isn't a fan of but it's superb despite that. Also, don't start playing if you have a fixed time you need to stop since you can't save anywhere and it's pretty easy to miss when the game saves (Tip: When you try to exit the game will tell you when it last saved and ask if you still want to).

Its amazing the best bioshock ive played but the ending does requre a bit of thinking over. 
all in all 
10/10

shut up and take my money

... mehr muss man zu diesem atemberaubenden spiel nicht sagen
Gute Story, sehr gutes Storytelling mit dem bisher besten, weil unaufdringlichsten, aber sehr glaubwürdigem und lebendigem Begleiter. Das Spiel an sich ist okay, das Spiel lebt von der Atmosphäre.

Anyone that has played and loved the first Bioshock will want to play Infinite. It is a truly amazing game with an excellent story line. It runs very well on my PC. Very smooth with a wealth of graphic options. The only gripe I have with this game is the FoV slider which only goes up to 70. You can however increase this in the config files thankfully (I like a full peripheral view). You can also make loads of other tweaks if one so desires. Like others have already said this is a truly memorable game, a proper PC game, a game that pushes the envelope on character development which creates an amazing experience. 10/10.
true tears cried

I've always been a fan of the BioShock series. My only issue is that I've been too afraid to play them, so I've resorted to watching playthroughs online. Luckily, this one doesn't scare me so I was actually able to play it myself. That being said, this game has possibly one of the greatest video game stories I have ever encountered. Let me reiterate, if you don't play this game, you are missing out on of the greatest video game adventures ever. Coupled with the gameplay, BioShock Infinte is an experience you don't want to miss. It features the same style of gameplay as the first two, you have guns and vigors (this game's version of plasmids). This time around, the vigors are almost completely different from one another whereas in the original BioShocks they mostly all did the same function of stunning and dealing damage. Your companion Elizabeth also adds a whole new element to the game, which is completely new in any game I've ever seen. At a moment's notice you are able to completely change the environment of the battlefield. Be it summoning an automaton ally or creating cover that wasn't there previously, each battle is a dynamic environment that is consistently changing and never gets stale. And did I mention skyhooks? Oh yeah, there is a rail system which you can ride around on in the middle of battle kiting your enemies and moving to different locations quickly. All in all, this is one of the best games I've ever played and I can't recommend it enough.
Best single player FPS. Very unique.
Great game,Wasn't too great in the first hour of story,But after that It got great. Much Awesome. Buy now. wow.
Absolutely Mind blowing, truly amazing, Get this game!

Welcome to the city of Columbia. Floating amongst the clouds, cruising far above sea level, this is a place unlike any you've ever seen. Please enjoy your voyage... 

The third game in the popular Bioshock series, BioShock Infinite breaks away from the underwater setting of the first two games to take players into a floating city held aloft by dirigibles. The game is set in 1912. You play as Booker DeWitt, a disgraced former private detective who's picked up a new case. Your goal is to find Elizabeth, a young woman who's gone missing and return her unharmed. The only problem is that she's being kept on this flying city. Columbia was once a symbol of America's success as a nation, floating around the world as a traveling World's Fair, a marvel of human innovation. But strange things have happened since Columbia's unveiling in 1900, and now the city has disappeared into the clouds. DeWitt knows how to find it, but over the years stories have been told about Columbia having unlawful heavy armament and deranged citizenry. Do not expect this to be a pleasure cruise.

Irrational Games returns with more of what established them as a industry heavy-hitter back in 2007 with the original Bioshock: wildly creative atmosphere/game environment, sharp character development, AAA story that makes for a memorable experience and adds to game replay value and very inventive FPS mechanics.There are few companies that make games where you ought to buy them without thinking twice and Irrational Games are one of them.

I only got chance to buy this game recently, after playing the first 2 I didn't know whether to buy it. I thought it was just silly how the game looked. I mean, a floating city.. really? But this game has very much surprised me. The thought that has gone into it is just incredible. There are so many twists throughout to keep you entertained through the entire game. I couldn't stop playing it. The graphics are amazing and it runs great, you also get attached to Elizabeth and the ending does not disapoint. This game has surprised me and is now one of my favorites. 10/10 imo

Das Spiel ist einfach der ober Hammer. Ich kann es jedem nur Empfehlen. Das Spiel fesselt einen einfach ich habe alleine gestern 9.9 Stunden gespielt und habe noch nicht mal die Hälfte durch. Also für das Preis/Leistungs verhältniss TOP.

It made me feel things I never thought existed.
Then it blew my mind.
Most impressive last game i've played!
Storia formidabile, grafica fantastica!! :D

at least a 4/5. I enjoyed the story line and the enviorment they set you in, it's very immersive. The graphics are a bit patchy in my opinion but some of that was just the art style chose for all of the Bioshocks.

If you enjoy a very open feeling yet stable world, I would suggest this game. Great folklore and wonderful mechanics.
Exceedingly excellent game. Fantastic story, Amazingly beautiful world. Great fighting system. Do youself a favour and buy this game!

A great addition to the bioshock franchise, I had alot of fun with it, looking forward to playing all the dlc's.
fantastic game 10/10
Концовка печальная..А так отличная сюжетная линия!

Bioshock Infinite has to be one of the best games I've played this year. I'll admit, after Bioshock 2 I lost faith in the games, but after playing Bioshock Infinite, not only did the game exceed my expectations, it had me set my standards higher for what a single player game SHOULD be. Graphics are absolutely stunning, Combat has vastly improved, and Columbia offers some of the best and memorable experiences in gaming history.

After a sluggish second game, Bioshock returns to what made the first game the stuff of legends: Tons of action, a solid interface (especially given the number of attack options available to the player), and a seriously compelling storyline. And as the icing on the cake, we no longer have to deal with the cumbersome Games for Windows Live interface.
Der beste Story-Shooter den ich bisher spielen dürfte. grenzt an ein Meisterwerk!

This is like the first Bioshock, but you actuallyget to see the fabulous city before it gets ransacked by lunatics.  And your choices don't matter.
Over all, it's not bad.  The only thing new this adds to the series would be the skyhook sequences, which might be more fun if they happened in slow motion so you could actually hit somethng instead of careening through the air (although more competent FPS players would likely disagree).  The story is okay, if a little contrived (but that's mostly a mater of opinion, and it seems most people think the story is brilliant).
All in all, I don't get the hype this game got.  But it's still a decent game.
This game is Beautiful, it's fast paced combat puts a smile on my inner child...Mainly because i can shoot lighting from my hands and punch people with a saw

Una calidad de juego extraordinaria. Me impresiona su gráfica, dinamismo, historia y jugabilidad. Un 10 de 10 seguro. Antes de jugarlo (y jugar su DLC!!!) altamente recomiendo jugar el primer Bioshock (el cual, dentro de mis libros, tiene un 11 de 10)

Solo puedo decir una cosa de este juego: es ASOMBROSO. Supera en historia a sus antecesores. Y la jugabilidad la mantiene correctamente. Creo que es el mejor juego que e jugado en mi vida, sobre todo por su historia, te deja boqueabierto todo lo que pasa. Sinceramente, no dejeis pasar la oportunidad de jugarlo, os aseguro que no os arrepentireis. 10/10
божественная хуйн!!!!

мне кажется это самая лучшая игра из серии BIOSHOCK. Интересная сюжетнаю линия, но простоватое оружие . Также огромный плюс игры это способностти главного героя когда выппив флакон он может метнуть огненный шар призвать воронов убийц и т.п.
Есть у в игре есть мисси которые просто требуют стелса , и разработчики должны были ввести хотя бы одну тихую способность или оружие. Вобщем игра интересная и не жалкл потратить деньги играйте и наслаждаййтесь

BioShock Infinite one of my faviort game this year(GOTY 2013 ) i will give it 10/10 why
lets start with the story.

the story take place before BioShock 1&2 means in 1912 during the growth of American exceptionalism  takes places in Columbia (the city suspended in the air) where the fantasy started.

the main Characters is (Booker DeWitt) and hi companion (Elizabeth) , i like Booker 
character so much and good choice of chosing Troy Baker he is amazing.

there is so much Destruction,running and a lot of scene you will not expected.

BioShock Infinite uses Unreal Engine which makes the graphics so amazing  the designs is so thrilling alot of details in this game 




the game is absolutely worth it.
